Until one day after my spin class, I wandered into Poppy's.

I had a ham/egg/cheese on a bagel, which was super fresh and made that morning.  They even scooped out the bagel for me so I wouldn't eat so much of the bread!!!  So accommodating.  I've been back a few times just to get a variety of a dozen bagels an some cream cheese.  They have a few other deli sides you can get by the 1/4, 1/2 or 1lb container.

Warning, if you want to go on the weekend, GO EARLY.  The line can be insane starting around 9:30am.  Goes somewhat quick though, because they are fully staffed to deal with the morning rush.  There must have been about 25 people in front of me, and I was ordering within 10-15 minutes.  This place is now a carbolicious regular for me, and I'm so happy to be eating some yummy NY style bagels again that taste good!

Perhaps the best Bagels in Charlotte, although pricey at $11 a dozen and there appears to be a problem with consistancy as some days the Bagels are better than other days. The problem is the indifference of the counter people who seem to think that serving the in-house customers is of secondary importance to talking on the phone or with each other, or attending to chores, which while necessary, could be done AFTER taking care of customers. The Bagels are great and large enough that they won't fit in your average toaster, so they are worth the $11 price tag. Work on your bedside manner folks!
This is my favorite place to eat in Charlotte. I love getting a plain bagel with turkey and cheddar cheese on the grill  my FAVORITE.

Surprised to find such a great spot that's very unassuming. The breakfast special is great. It's bacon egg and cheese on a bagel with a cup of coffee. The bagel was great the bacon egg and cheese part was excellent. They have iced coffee which is a nice touch and people working there seem pretty nice too

Poppy's is almost always packed - normally I am a reservation/appointment/assigned seating advocate but in this case, it's worth rolling the dice! I mean you can always take it to go, right? The freshly baked bagels make you wonder why you'd ever go anywhere else for a bagel. Definitely a favorite - plus we love the outside seating option for nice weekend days
Had the salmon w/ jalape√±o cream cheese on an Asiago bagel & it was delicious! I'm definitely a fan.
Best bagels in Charlotte! Great breakfast sandwiches and parking is easy. Very nice staff and can make your own iced coffee.

Rude ass place. I stood in line alone waiting for someone to take my order. No one acknowledged me. An older gentleman came in and someone quickly took his order. It was plenty of people swarming in behind the counter and it wasn't busy. I won't be back if that's how you treat customers.

Poppys is our favorite bagel place in Charlotte. Food is wonderful. They could benefit from a larger establishment. There have been a few times I pulled up and saw the line out the door and turned around to grab poppys bagels from Harris Teeter and make my own breakfast at home. Did you know Harris Teeter on East Blvd sells Poppy's bagels in the bakery, near the doughnuts?? Their bagels are the best in town!
Great bagels, nice and chewy, comparable to New York. Best I've found in Charlotte. I love the asiago with scallion cream cheese and I've never wanted to try anything else.

Stopped in for bagels before we hit the pool and were very impressed. Awesome flavors of cream cheese and the bagels were so fresh. Adorable little shop that we will absolutely go back to. Good prices, good food, good experience.

Love this place. I would stop on my way to work when I was running late.  If you're gonna be late might as well get breakfast... thats my motto.  I love their BEC bagel so delicious even after reheating throughout the day.  They have such a variety of cream cheese spreads I never seen anything like it.  To make it even more special, my hubby and I stopped here to grab a quick bite before heading off on our honeymoon.  He loved it! We split a bagel with lox and cream cheese it was delicious and was perfect to split since we're both a little lactose intolerant.  Everyone is so friendly here.  I love it, definitely a must try, think Panera, but actually worth the calories.
Love, love, love Poppy's! You can get coupon inserts and the best bagels in Charlotte in one place! I HIGHLY, HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PLACE!

This place has a five star reputation but this trip it gave a four star experience.  First off, if it's the weekend, expect to wait in a super long line.  You would think that would be a good sign and yes it normally is, this day they were struggling to keep hot food coming out so order something cold.  That's what did, unfortunately my wife and mother did not and theirs was a miss this trip.  We normally love this place and will be back soon.  Bagels are solid normally, the portion of smoked salmon on mine was very small compared to a typical NY deli but at only 7.99, half the price so I am ok with half the portion.  We will be back soon to give them another try.

The best bagel place I have found so far in Charlotte. The staff at Poppy's is so sweet! The bagel was fresh and soft just like a good bagel should be! I tried the veggie cream cheese and it was excellent. Poppy's reminds me of my favorite bagel shop back home. Only wish it was bigger and not quite so crowded. I will be headed back soon to try more on their menu because everything looked delicious!!!

The lines here move quickly and the service is stone-faced and efficient.  Oh, and the bagels are really really good!

By far the beat bagel I've had here in Charlotte since I've moved from NEW YORK!

Their bagels have the perfect crunch/texture on the outside and perfectly soft in the inside. 

If you're in the area, definitely stop in!!

This is a great place to go! I'm new in town and was looking for a good location to start my work day i.e. Eat a yummy breakfast and read emails and this was it! The staff answered all of my questions even when I asked what pumpernickel tasted like. Then after I paid he gave me one to try! I will definitely come back and encourage others to come as well!
Best bagels ever and the egg salad is amazing. If you like lox, this is the place to go

Fast, fresh cute breakfast/lunch spot. My husband and I went and saw there was a line but it went through it quick. Fresh warm bagels and the fresh foods in the case looks amazing will definitely be back for the chicken salad. Pastries looked delicious Coffee was fresh and prices decent. Will be back and lucky enough for us it's close to our house!

I used to live in Charlotte, NC & I remember when this placed first opened. My family & I always came here because we are from NY and they had the best bagels. My sisters and niece still live there & I travel back and forth at least twice a month!! I will no longer be going there and either will my family ....The lady owner or manager not sure what she was hung up on me and offended me pretty bad. 

In 2015 I was diagnosed with Eosinophilic Esophagitis (when your white blood cells attack your esophagus due to food allergies). I can no longer eat DAIRY or WHEAT.  She literally could care less about gluten free people because "they make too much money" and also "they make fresh bagels".  She wouldn't even let me come in to drop off a FREE sample of "NY STYLE" Gluten Free frozen bagels (comes in every flavor) that a lot of NY bagel shops have in the EC.

People who are not gluten free don't understand what it is like to be turned away. Your customers should come first AlWAYS & not be hung up on.  It's not possible to make fresh gluten free bagels and fresh regular bagels (cross contamination). So the best next option is Frozen (if you are gluten free you could relate to me as long as we can eat it we don't care if it's fresh or frozen).

Anyway, I'm offended, hurt and was highly mistreated. 

Just a quick fact....

"Today, some 3.1 million people across the United States follow a gluten-free diet. 72 percent of them are classified as "PWAGs" - people without celiac disease avoiding gluten"- Forbes Magazine 

Moral of the story if you need to know where to get gluten free bagels in Charlotte feel free to inbox me or follow me on Instagram @yourallergyangel -  Believe it or not some bagel shop owners understand !

We've been dying to try Poppy's for a while now as we've watched the great reviews pour in... Finally made it in the Saturday after Christmas and were met with a bustling, noisy crowd and a long line. Don't let the crowd fool you... It took us less than 10 minutes to order and find a table. 

We had the breakfast sandwiches -- bacon, egg and cheese for me, sausage egg and cheese for him. Both on an everything bagel. Both AMAZING! The bagels had a great crunch but we're still soft inside. The fillings were fresh, flavorful and hot. We also tried a scone because I read a few good things in reviews here. The scone was just average; I've had better and worse. Next time (and, oh there will be a lot of next times!) we'll stick with what I'm pretty sure they do best... Bagels!! We're also looking forward to trying the homemade cream cheese. I spotted someone with blueberry cream cheese and might have drooled a little bit.

Great food and service. I've only had the breakfast bagel sandwiches here, which are fantastic. My fianc√© has tried the Ruben and said it was great (didn't beat Eddie's Place though!). If you typically go to Owen's Bagels, you will realize that the texture of the bagels at Poppy's are quite different.  Owen's has more of a chewy texture, in my opinion. The coffee cake was amazing, too! So delicious... I wish I had a piece right now!

Will definitely be back!

OK- I think these are officially the best bagels in Charlotte.

They are no New York bagels. Go into it with that understanding. However, they are delicious and the closest thing to NY bagels in Charlotte.

Great little bagel shop, a bit of a pain to get to with the busy road next to it. The dinning  room is cramped but there are chairs outside. Like others have said the staff is efficient and all business. No chatty workers here. But the bagels are top notch and the service is quick even when busy. I would come back for sure because the food was so good. The coffee ain't half bad either. Try the NY Lox on an Everything bagel it's great!
Decent food, cute atmosphere. Really busy on Sunday morning but they did a good job getting everyone through quickly.
I can't remember what bagel I had, but I think it had cheese on it. The bagel and the cream cheese were the best I've had. Also tried their iced coffee which was good. Would return!

Always delicious. Best noodle kugel in town and the bagels are legit. Long lines always move unbelievably fast. No charge cards under $5 FYI. Chicken salad is also very good. The now covered outdoor seating is a bonus.

Walking in the line was wrapped around the restaurant. The atmosphere reminds me of a New York bagel shop and actually moved pretty fast. We had our bagels about 20 minutes later.

I got the bacon egg and cream cheese everything bagel.  It was delicious and filling.  

Poppy's has Monday-Friday B.E.C. With coffee for less than $6.  There are also low fat options.  

Next time I will probably do call ahead to avoid the line.

Poppy's Bagel's is definitely worth the stop!

I'm loving it.  They really did have great bagels.  Great crisp outside, soft doughy inside.  This place was recommended to me by another Yelper and I'm glad she did.

I had to battle some traffic to get there but it was worth the wait and made for an excellent breakfast.  They have an excellent assortment of cream cheeses and a large inventory of bagels.  Line was short so it didn't take forever.  

I wasn't a fan of the coffee, but the bagel made up for it!  I ordered for my team at work and we had everything bagels with plain cream cheese and blueberry bagels with blueberry cream cheese.

Bagels are delicious! The everything bagel had so much flavor. I stuck with the basic bacon, egg and cheese for my first visit, but they had a lot of sandwiches and bagels that sounded really interesting. Was not impressed with the latkes. Ours weren't heated all the way and were just kind of dense and bland. They were really busy during Sunday brunch time!! Would stop by again while in the area, but now we know not to try and get there from Uptown during the time all the churches let out. The whole area gets packed!

What this world needs are more joints with good bagels, because as it stands now, we have to drive a good ways to get one.  Sure, there are options, but they are so far away.

Unlike Andy, who has to merely walk across the parking lot (an adventure in itself, I am sure), we are a good bit away from Poppy's, which is a shame, as they have some nice offerings.  Thinking on it, it is probably a good thing, since if I were closer, I would probably be popping out of my pants if I ate here as much as I wanted.

Though they are maybe not the friendliest - having to get through a line of Charlotteans wanting their bagel fix will do that to you - they serve up a good bagel quickly certainly and that is about all that matters, right?

Memorial day breakfast, homemade everything bagel and egg bagel all the way with lox, cream cheese , red onion & capers. Bagels were perfectly toasted, nicely constructed sandwich, fresh and delicious as always.

I have to say that I came to Poppy's with high expectations based on the overwhelmingly positive reviews but left disappointed. After taking a quick look at the menu, I decided that a bagel breakfast sandwich sounded good and for $4.50 was a decent deal, so I went for the ham, egg, and cheese on an everything bagel. They had a number of side salads including potato salad, pasta salads, and various vegetable mixes but I figured a bagel sandwich would be enough for today and stuck with just that. (They also have some muffins, cookies, soups, paninis, other sandwiches, sodas, and a few different types of coffee).
The sandwich came out pretty quickly, especially since they cooked my egg to order, and the worker brought it right to my table which was nice. Upon first bite of the sandwich though I was hugely disappointed. The bagel was very dry and extremely chewy and dense, and did not taste all that fresh. I also realized very quickly that the bagel was way too large for the scant amount of toppings (2 very thin slices of ham, a small egg, and maybe a full slice of American cheese but it may have only been a half slice because it covered only half the bagel). I ended up eating the rest of the sandwich as one open faced half with the toppings and one half plain bagel, but it didn't improve things a lot.
I must say that the flavor of the everything bagel was really, really good. It had just the right amount of garlic and onion, and the seeds added a nice touch and didn't all fall off like they do at a lot of places. Unfortunately with the bagel being dry, it still wasn't very enjoyable. Maybe I'll come back to Poppy's to try a bagel with one of their cream cheese options and hope that the flavor of this bagel rather than the freshness is truly how their bagels usually are.

Mmmm carbo-licious. 

I met the lovely Ms. Tonya P for a brief bagel this morning and 'twas delicious. Carby, crunchity toasted bagels (mmm sesame) and fab cream cheese. The schmear has to be homemade right? Because I dabbled in the chive and the vegetable - both were equally tasty. 

Inside Poppy's has a smattering of tables and a cute little patio outside where Riley (my pup) enjoyed some bagel bits off of the concrete. Tasty. Be aware that the patio can be quite noisy with the umpteen cars passing down Providence and Sharon Amity, but no worries, I had my bagel and great company. 

Next time I'm in the area, I'm definitely going to pop in and pay homage to Poppy's by indulging in a nice toasty bagel and a pound of cream cheese. Nice to know that there's another local bagel joint in CLT!

Went to lunch with my wife and she was very happy with her Egg Salad on a Garlic Bagel. The bagels are great, which show the owner's NY roots. I got an Italian Sub. It was very good, the meat was fresh but it was pre-made, not hand sliced and in the deli-fridge so the bread was cold.

Bagel sandwiches are my favorite breakfast item and these do not disappoint! I absolutely love their bacon, egg, and cheese bagel sandwiches. The bagels are delicious and fresh too. Not too hard and not too soft. Additionally, the egg is cooked fresh on a griddle to order, not microwaved! Their coffee is pretty good too. I've always been impressed with how friendly the staff is no matter how busy it is there (and it's always busy because it's so popular)! Good news is that the lines always move fast and it never takes too long to get your food.

Best bagel place in town! I'm serious, this place is sooo good whether you just want a normal bagel with cream cheese or a super delicious bagel breakfast sandwich. I get myself a breakfast bagel almost every week...that's how good it is! I recommend the everything bagel because it adds so much flavor to whatever you get! I usually always get an everything bagel toasted with cream cheese, over medium/over easy (whatever I'm feeling that day) and sausage. Might sound a little weird at first but every person I've gotten to try this combo has loved it, although it can be a little messy but in my book messy usually means super good!

Great bagels decent coffee. Guy up front who rings you up is always friendly. Fast for how busy they are on the weekends and during the week it's even better. Go to bagel/ breakfast spot on this side of town. Never had a bad experience

Visited for the first time recently. I immediately regretted my decision when I saw the long line winding around the interior, but kudos to the staff for keeping things moving. The wait was much shorter than I anticipated, but it did feel kinda cramped in there with the line wrapping around.

I had an everything bagel, lightly toasted, with veggie cream cheese. It was massive and delicious. Loved the fresh bell pepper in the spread!

Since they have "and More" in their name, I probably shouldn't have been surprised, but they do have a ton of other offerings if you're not craving a bagel. I was particularly intrigued by the array of salads in the cold case, and I'll definitely make it a point to drop in for lunch sometime.

I had been eyeing Poppy's for a while now since I frequent Flywheel on a regular basis, and I finally gave in to the carb-loading temptation post-workout. Be prepared for a wait in the morning hours, but it was impressive to see how quickly the staff is able to move through orders. However, there were issues with my order that marred my experience. For some strange reason, when the employee called my name for me to grab my order, he realized that he had never prepared my order. Not sure what that was about. He quickly grabbed my two bagels and cream cheese to go, but neither were toasted (which I had asked) and one had the wrong flavor of cream cheese (plain, not the veggie that I had ordered). The bright point of the experience was the bagels themselves. I tried the asiago and grabbed a blueberry for my mister. Both were delicious! I would consider coming back despite my messed up order because they were that good. Also, it seems like they have daily specials listed up front. Be on the lookout for $4.99 bagel sandwich specials.
A little taste of New York and New Jersey in Charlotte! Perfect bagels, Taylor Ham, and an awesome cream cheese variety, this place is a must-try breakfast spot.

This place is very yummy, but pricey.  I think it is just too overpriced for what you are getting.  I find that extremely disappointing because I have never had bad food or service here. I will try it again sometime.

Time: 10am. Place: Poppy's. Impulse purchase: Bagels, doz. Intent: I get to play Bagel Fairy all day with a dozen of the best bagels in Charlotte.

I distributed my cache of carb thoughtfully, but thoroughly. And not before eating two in one sitting. Bagelbloat, yeesh.

Coffee was just OK but I honestly don't think they care much about anything except the bagatorial arts up in Poppy's and in that distinguished category, they get an A+. Sad to me that Bore's Head is what they have for slices and cheeses since that stuff is just nasty, but hey.

No more Bruegger's for me. No more terrorizing Owen. I get Poppy bagels, I eat Poppy bagels, I love Poppy bagels.

note - these suckers are such globs of gluten that they don't age very well - freeze 'em, if you must, instead of sitting 'em in the breadbox.

don't really review places much, but after catching a review on poppy's bagels i had to respond.  i'm a cook from the northeast, but have been living here for 20+ years.  we recently started getting our bagels from poppy's and i have to say that so far they are the best bagels i've had since living and working in food establishments here.  i haven't actually eaten there yet so i can't comment on the rest of their menu since their operating hours don't coincide with my working hours.  they close pretty early.
Usually have good experiences from Poppy's. Not today. Waited about a half an hour for an egg and cheese on an everything bagel. I got his burnt bagel with barely any seasoning.

Their bagels are super fresh!  Real New York style bagels.  My coworker grabs some on Fridays for our team at work, and we end up eating them for both breakfast and lunch. Their cream cheese is homemade, my favorite is the Veggie!  All their different bagels are good, but can't resist that Asiago cheese.

New York-like atmosphere. A lot of energy and the efficiency is excellent. It was crowded when we went, which was 12:30 on a Sunday. This is a positive sign. I always worry when a restaurant has few-to-no customers at peak times. 

As far as the bagels, one was soft and the others were more on the well done side. The toasted bagel was very good, and my wife really enjoyed the everything with vegetable cream cheese. On the other hand, we live in Huntersville and usually go to Bagel Bin. While Poppy's Bagels are good, we like Bagel Bin bagels more. We didn't try any sandwiches, soups, or salads at Poppy's Bagels, so keep that in mind. And a big positive for Poppy's Bagels is that their prices are better than Bagel Bin.

Overall, Poppy's Bagels is recommended. Since it's a long drive for us, we wouldn't go back unless in the area. But if you live nearby and like bagels, then you should probably check it out.

I used to come here all the time, and still do like 1-4 times a month-- just not several times a week.

I need to mention that the bagels are DEFINITELY not the reason I'm only giving 3 stars. If I had only ever had the bagels, I would easily give Poppy's 5 stars. I LOVE the bagels. They're bigger than most places in the area, and the cream cheese doesn't taste overly sweet like other bagel shops where it tastes like powdered sugar was added to the cream cheese.

My biggest complaint is the cannoli. Specifically the filling. I have ordered over 40 cannoils from Poppy's over the span of a year and a half, and literally... not one single time has it been right. Sometimes there is a huge gap in the middle with no filling, sometimes there's just a line of filling and you can literally look right through the cannoli and see what's on the other side. Every time, I say "Please make sure it's actually filled." I literally feel like it's overkill for me to have to say it. I was assured today that it would be completely filled. Guess what?! It wasn't. I've complained about this several times, and stopped getting cannolis because of this, and I was having a pregnancy craving today, and ONCE AGAIN the cannoli was basically empty. I'm tired of them telling me that you can't fill a cannoli all the way. You can. I lived in Italy and make cannolis at home. I have never had "settling" issues or gap issues. You have to spend more than 5 seconds to fill it! That's literally all you do-- you take a little more time, and boom, it's filled! I would LOVE to show the staff how to fill a cannoli, but apparently, they don't need my help. (Trust me, the do need my help.)

I was underwhelmed with Poppy's. The line on a Sunday morning at 9:30 was out the door, so I had high hopes. The line moved fairly quickly, but it was just a cluster of confusion in the restaurant. 

We had two bacon, egg, and cheese bagels and felt they were remarkably average. They have 4 coffee options but none of the flavors were just standard blend medium roast - they had hazelnut, dark roast, French vanilla, and chocolate raspberry. Where was a standard flavor? 

Also the patio was extremely dirty - cigarette butts, ashes, and just general debris was scattered about. They need a broom and a power washer! 

Pro tip: Go to Owen's Bagel instead!

I had the "breakfast special"...it is the bagel with an egg, bacon cheese and coffee for $5.50. I chose the honey wheat bagel but overall the breakfast didn't have much taste. Maybe it needed salt but was hoping for a good taste. The coffee is very good. However I can't give them 5 stars because of the taste. The service is good but it is conveyer belt style when you walk in. So if you're not ready, they can easily get the order of the person behind you....it happened. Yay. I might try it again though.

The bagels were good
The attitude of a lady who works behind the counter and yelled at my wife for no reason at all is another story
All she did was ask if she can get a refill on a fountain soda and this lady snapped on her as if she was committing a felony and told her she couldn't come in
Because of her attitude we won't be coming back and it ruined bed what could of been a pleasant dining experience 
A shame because the bagels were decent
Being a new transplant to Charlotte, originally from NYC, I had to try it out. Definitely very New Yorky. Not as good as the bagels I'm used to, but definitely one of the best bagels in Charlotte.

Truly the tastiest bagels in this area!! Panera watch out! 

Clean area inside, but not much seating. Plan to take out. $11 for a dozen bagels. Freshest assortment of cream cheese. 

$5.49 bagel breakfast with coffee, Monday through Friday only. You get choice of bagel with egg, cheese, and meat choice. I get bacon or ham.  Simply delicious!
THE BEST bagels in charlotte! Tried the pumpkin pie cream cheese for the 1st time last week and back for more today!
Amazing bagels and an amazing staff. They go out of the way to make your bagel the best a bagel can be. I come eat here as often as I'm in the area. I would give them 10 stars if I could!!

Really good local deli. I ordered your basic egg salad (on a whole grain bagel) and the matzo ball soup. I love soup in the winter, in the heat of the summer -- anytime (and Poppy's Matzo ball soup satisfies my soup-love). Poppy's is a cute little place that can easily be overlooked in a Cotswold shopping center if you don't know any different. 

Excellent lunch spot (some would say breakfast). I will certainly be back for more soup, bagels & bagel sandwiches. I also love the family feel of Poppy's -- placing it head and shoulders above the chains.

Stopped in there around 11:00 this morning and they were still making piping hot bagels! Being that I choose my carbs wisely, bagels is something that I eat about once or twice a year. While I do love them, I would rather use my cheat meal on another food item, preferably, dessert. 
Well, these were really good bagels with some delicious cream cheese. I always love to get a toasted onion bagel (with the center of the dough scooped out to cut carbs of course!) with veggie cream cheese. My son and daughter both got their cinnamon raisin bagel, one with plain cream cheese and the other with raisin walnut cream cheese. My husband got a bacon, egg, and cheese bagel. We also ordered a blueberry muffin as it was taunting us as we were paying. Everything was delicious. Yummy freshly made cream cheese spreads. Lots of fresh and crunchy vegetables in my veggie one. My daughter loved the raisin walnut cream cheese as it was sweet and flavorful. The plain was fluffy and creamy. Definitely a great place to stop in for breakfast or lunch. The counter was full of different kinds of salads- pasta, egg, tuna, chicken, shrimp. They had all kinds of amazing looking items in their case. I know that we will going back very soon to try their shrimp salad and blueberry blintzes.
seating might be an issue but prices are decent and the bagel with lox and cream cheese was great.  Too bad I forgot my left overs in my in-laws fridge when I returned home.

I can't go anywhere else for bagels after trying the ones here! They are seriously so delicious and fresh. I literally dream about these bagels. Cream cheeses are great too- asiago bagel/jalapeno cream cheese is my current go-to combo, but the scallion and plain cream cheeses and everything bagels are excellent too, as is the lox. They also have good coffee. It gets busy and they close at 3, so your best bet is to visit on weekdays and early (before they run out of the asiago bagels). Do yourself a favor and stop here next time you're in Cotswold.

Been a weekly customer for 5 years.  The bagels are excellent but the place is filthy.  The manager explained they are too busy to clean table tops & floors?  The current conditions will probably relieve some of the traffic and allow time for cleaning!

Discovered Poppy's after mass at St. Gabriel's Church, I had the lox and bagel, capers, onions & it was delicious. I came back a few more times before heading back to StL. We were in town visiting family over Christmas.

Great bagels, homemade cream cheese and sandwiches, but steer clear of the pastries and ready made foods. We tried pastries two different times and the donut was the STALEST donut I've ever had. My daughter who never turns down sweets even refused it. We also got a cookie once and it was ROCK HARD. Shame on them for serving stale pastries. If you go, stick to their bagels and cc.

What a great bagel. The staff is friendly and they offer a wide variety of bagels, sandwiches, omelets, etc. The bagels are great, fresh, large, and sliced upon order. I ordered a everything bagel with egg, cheese, and turkey. It came out hot and was delicious! 
I look forward to returning to try a lunch sandwich.
Ok we LOVVEEEE this place. Yes the line is long on the weekends, its small, but its WORTH. I love the food the staff and the bagels I love  that I found a place that gives me my NYC  carb fix

Wonderful bagel shop, a small place with lots of options!
I first thought this was just a simple bagel and coffee spot but after visiting here, I see there is more to this book than it's cover.

I agree with everyone who has said that these are the best bagels in Charlotte. As a former New Yorker myself, I know a good bagel. While the interesting flavors they offer at Panera and those other chains are... interesting... the stuff they have here at Poppy's is the real deal. Everything, Sesame, Pumpernickel, all the classic flavored bagels and they're all large and fresh and fluffy with the great chewy and crunchy bagel texture that they are supposed to have.

Tip: spend an extra buck and get the salmon spread on your toasted bagel.

It's probably not the sort of place where you sit around all day, like a Starbucks or Panera, but it's nice for a quiet coffee (good coffee, by the way!) and a friendly meet with your buddies. In the nicer weather, sit outside in the sun. No wifi.

I don't understand how this place has such great ratings. The food is pretty good but the service is terrible. I just waited 20 minutes for four bagels with cream cheese. And it wasn't busy. Another woman asked the cashier about her order and got a really rude response. Not impressed.

If you're looking for a NY bagel, you've come to the right place. It's on my way to work and church, so I drive by 6 days a week. That, my friends, is trouble.

No frills. Bagels and bagel sandwiches are available, as well as myriad other items. I never stray from my standard order:

Blueberry bagel. Toasted. With butter.

It really makes mornings all the more bearable.
Excellent bagels. One of the best bagel shop/deli in Charlotte.  Really gives that NYC/NJ authentic experience. We love it when we are able to stop here.

Thank you Poppy's for being in Charlotte. A great bagel is easy to talk about but hard to find. Take a ride up Providence and you will be relieved to find that ever elusive great bagel, with wonderful people behind the counter. Even though we are still hoping for one in the Ballantyne area, Poppy's has become one of those places you are willing to drive a little father for. Try it, like it, love it. But not so much that all the seats are taken when I try to get in for lunch.
Great bagel!  Crunchy on the outside and soft inside.  I enjoyed an everything bagel with egg, turkey sausage and cheddar cheese.  The turkey sausage was not very good.  Had an artificial taste.

Poppy's is still the best place to get a bagel in Charlotte and people have noticed.  The last few times I have been there, on Sunday early afternoons, it has been a frustrating experience.  The line is a long maze, hard to fine the end, in the way of everyone entering or leaving the establishment, also blocking the coffee bar.

Poppy's, please fix the unorganized line and ordering process. How about another register or a real POS system? Please stop asking everyone if they want their bagel toasted.  It is a waste of time and an insult to your bagels.  They do not need to be toasted because they are already super fresh, still warm most of the time I get them.  You get bagels from Dunkin Donuts toasted because they taste like crap otherwise.  People are not used to getting Bagels of your quality and freshness and just assume getting the bagel toasted is the right thing to do.  If I was you I would hang a big sign up that says "we do not toast our bagels, because fresh bagels do not need to be toasted".
